message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.DS 

This paper addresses the problem of learning from imbalanced data using a Nearest-Neighbor algorithm, which is a common problem in machine learning and falls under the category of supervised learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also introduces a new algorithm based on geometrical ideas, which involves modifying the decision boundaries of the NN algorithm, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also provides a theoretical justification for the weighting scheme used in the algorithm, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper performs an extensive experimental study on many public imbalanced datasets and a tax fraud detection task, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
